chav1961.purelib.basic

Class CharUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • chav1961.purelib.basic.CharUtils

  • public class CharUtils
extends Object

    This class contains implementation of the most-commonly-used char data parsing/printing functions in the system.

    All the parsing methods in the class are oriented to direct parsing of the char arrays. Every method accepts source data array and starting position from it to parse, and returns the position in the source array after parsing. This returned value can then be used in the subsequent calls as starting position. Any parsed object are returned from the methods thru the arrays of appropriative data. This technique emulates call-by-reference mode for the method parameters, for example:

    final char[] source = "1234 1234".toCharArray();
    final int[] value1 = new int[1], value2 = new int[1];
    final int endPos1 = CharsUtil.parseInt(source,0,value1,false); // endPos1 = 4, value1[0] = 1234
    final int endPos2 = CharsUtil.parseInt(source,endPos1+1,value2,false); // endPos2 = 9, value2[0] = 5678

    All the printing methods in the class are oriented to direct filling of the char arrays. Every method accepts target data array and the free starting position to fill result, and returns the new free position in the array. Negative returned value means that the target array is too short to keep result. It absolute value exactly reflect new free position in the target array and can be used to expand target array to required size

    All the methods in the class are thread-safe

    Since:
    0.0.1 last update 0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    JUnit tests

      • parseInt

        public static int parseInt(char[] source,
                           int from,
                           int[] result,
                           boolean checkOverflow)

        Extract unsigned integer value from the current position of the source data

        Parameters:
        source - source data contains character representation of the integer value
        from - starting position in the source data
        result - array (at least new int[1]) to store parsed value
        checkOverflow - need check overflow when parsing data
        Returns:
        position of the first char in the source after successful parsing of the current integer
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parsing errors ware detected

      • parseNumber

        public static int parseNumber(char[] source,
                              int from,
                              long[] result,
                              int preferences,
                              boolean checkOverflow)

        Extract unsigned numeric value from the current position of the source data. This method uses a preferrable parameter to define data type you wish to get. Available preferences are described by PREF_INT, PREF_LONG, PREF_DOUBLE and PREF_ANY constants. This method always attempts to 'minimize' data type for parsed value (if value is greater than maximal integer, represents data as long, and if value is greater than maximal long, represents it as double).

        Parameters:
        source - source data contains character representation of the integer value
        from - starting position in the source data.
        result - array (new long[2]) to store parsed value. The first element contains parsed value, the second - current data type of the value (PREF_INT, PREF_LONG or PREF_DOUBLE). If the data type is PREF_DOUBLE, you need call Double.longBitsToDouble(long) method to convert the first element of array to double value
        preferences - available data types you wish to get
        checkOverflow - need check overflow when parsing data
        Returns:
        position of the first char in the source after successful parsing of the current integer
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parsing errors ware detected

      • symbolNeedsEscaping

        public static boolean symbolNeedsEscaping(char symbol,
                                          boolean strongEscaping)

        Test weather the given char need escaping in the external representation

        Parameters:
        symbol - symbol to test
        strongEscaping - true means mandatory escaping for all chars greater than 0xFF. False requires more smart analysis.
        Returns:
        true if the char need escaping

      • parseUnescapedString

        public static int parseUnescapedString(char[] source,
                                       int from,
                                       char terminal,
                                       boolean checkEscaping,
                                       int[] result)

        Parse unescaped string. This method defines location of the string was bound with the paired quotas (for example "before 'my string' after"). This method not supports any escape sequences inside the string. To process it, use parseString(char[], int, char, StringBuilder) method

        Parameters:
        source - source data contains character representation of the string value
        from - starting position in the source data. Starting position need points not to quota mark, but the first character in the string (see JUnit tests)
        terminal - quota mark to use for the string binding (usually (") or ('))
        checkEscaping - test presence of any escaping. If true, negative returned value from the method marks about it
        result - array (new int[2]) to store start and end position of the detected string
        Returns:
        position of the first char in the source after successful parsing of the current string. Will be negative if checkEscaping=true and any escape sequence in the string will be detected. It can be used for optimization purposes to avoid rare escaping processing
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parsing errors ware detected

      • parseString

        public static int parseString(char[] source,
                              int from,
                              char terminal,
                              StringBuilder result)

        Parse escaped string. DIffer to parseUnescapedString(char[], int, char, boolean, int[]) correctly process the escape sequences. Available escape sequences are oriented to the sequences used in the JSON string (see JSON description RFC)

        Parameters:
        source - source data contains character representation of the string value
        from - starting position in the source data. Starting position need points not to quota mark, but the first character in the string (see JUnit tests)
        terminal - quota mark to use for the string binding (usually (") or ('))
        result - string builder to store parsed string
        Returns:
        position of the first char in the source after successful parsing of the current string
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parsing errors ware detected

      • parseStringExtended

        public static int parseStringExtended(char[] source,
                                      int from,
                                      char terminal,
                                      StringBuilder result)

        Parse escaped string. DIffer to parseString(char[], int, char, StringBuilder) also correctly process advanced escape sequences (\0NNN and \0xNNN).

        Parameters:
        source - source data contains character representation of the string value
        from - starting position in the source data. Starting position need points not to quota mark, but the first character in the string (see JUnit tests)
        terminal - quota mark to use for the string binding (usually (") or ('))
        result - string builder to store parsed string
        Returns:
        position of the first char in the source after successful parsing of the current string
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any parsing errors ware detected

      • printLong

        public static int printLong(char[] content,
                            int from,
                            long value,
                            boolean reallyFill)
                     throws IllegalArgumentException

        Print long number to the char array

        Parameters:
        content - char array to fill with long
        from - start position in the char array to fill
        value - long value to fill to content
        reallyFill - weather really fill content. When false, only total filled size will be calculated
        Returns:
        new from position to continue filling content. Negative value marks that content is too short to keep value. It's absolute value exactly marks new from position to continue filling
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if any argument errors ware detected

      • printEscapedChar

        public static int printEscapedChar(char[] content,
                                   int from,
                                   char value,
                                   boolean reallyFill,
                                   boolean strongEscaping)
                            throws IllegalArgumentException

        Print char to char array with escaping it if need

        Parameters:
        content - char array to fill with long
        from - start position in the char array to fill
        value - char value to fill to content
        reallyFill - weather really fill content. When false, only total filled size will be calculated
        strongEscaping - true strongly escapes all chars > 0xFF. False makes smart analyze
        Returns:
        new from position to continue filling content. Negative value marks that content is too short to keep value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - on any argument errors
        Since:
        0.0.2

      • printEscapedCharArray

        public static int printEscapedCharArray(char[] content,
                                        int from,
                                        char[] value,
                                        int charFrom,
                                        int charTo,
                                        boolean reallyFill,
                                        boolean strongEscaping)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException

        Print string to the char array with escaping if need. String terminators will not be printed, so you must print it yourself

        Parameters:
        content - char array to fill with long
        from - start position in the char array to fill
        value - char array value to fill to content
        charFrom - start position inside char array to fill from
        charTo - end position inside char array to fill from
        reallyFill - weather really fill content. When false, only total filled size will be calculated
        strongEscaping - true strongly escapes all chars > 0xFF. False makes smart analyze
        Returns:
        new from position to continue filling content. Negative value marks that content is too short to keep value.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - on any argument errors
        Since:
        0.0.2

      • substitute

        public static String substitute(String key,
                                String value,
                                CharUtils.SubstitutionSource source)
                         throws NullPointerException,
                                IllegalArgumentException

        Substitute string content. Seeks the ${<key_to_substitute>} sequence inside string value and substitute it with the key_to_substitute value. This value will be got by calling CharUtils.SubstitutionSource.getValue(String) method.

        Parameters:
        key - optional key to identify string value. Will be used in the exceptions if will be thrown
        value - value for substitution.
        source - interface to get values for keys detected
        Returns:
        value with substituted keys
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when any parameters is null
        IllegalArgumentException - when any problems during substitution were detected
        Since:
        0.0.2

      • substitute

        public static char[] substitute(String key,
                                char[] value,
                                int from,
                                int length,
                                CharUtils.CharSubstitutionSource source)
                         throws NullPointerException,
                                IllegalArgumentException

        Substitute string content. Seeks the ${<key_to_substitute>} sequence inside string value and substitute it with the key_to_substitute value. This value will be got by calling CharUtils.SubstitutionSource.getValue(String) method.

        Parameters:
        key - optional key to identify string value. Will be used in the exceptions if will be thrown
        value - char array for substitution.
        from - start position in the char array to process substitution
        length - length of the content portion to process
        source - interface to get values for keys detected
        Returns:
        value with substituted keys
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when any parameters is null
        IllegalArgumentException - when any problems during substitution were detected
        Since:
        0.0.2

      • split

        public static String[] split(String source,
                             char splitter)
                      throws NullPointerException

        Split string into string arrays. Against String.split(String) doesn't use regular expressions

        Parameters:
        source - string to split
        splitter - splitter char
        Returns:
        string array with splitter string. Always contains at least one element
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when source string is null
        Since:
        0.0.2

      • split

        public static int split(String source,
                        char splitter,
                        String[] target)
                 throws NullPointerException

        Split string into string arrays. Against String.split(String) doesn't use regular expressions

        Parameters:
        source - string to split
        splitter - splitter char
        target - target array to receive strings splitted
        Returns:
        non-negative number - number of pieces of the splitted string, negative number - -(number of pieces of the splitted string + 1). Negative number means that target array is too small to receive content (nothing will be filled in this case)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when either source or target parameter is null
        Since:
        0.0.2

      • split

        public static String[] split(String source,
                             String splitter)
                      throws NullPointerException,
                             IllegalArgumentException

        Split string into string arrays. Against String.split(String) doesn't use regular expressions

        Parameters:
        source - string to split
        splitter - splitter char
        Returns:
        string array with splitter string. Always contains at least one element
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when source string is null
        IllegalArgumentException - when splitter is null or empty
        Since:
        0.0.2

      • split

        public static int split(String source,
                        String splitter,
                        String[] target)
                 throws NullPointerException,
                        IllegalArgumentException

        Split string into string arrays. Against String.split(String) doesn't use regular expressions

        Parameters:
        source - string to split
        splitter - splitter char
        target - target array to receive strings splitted
        Returns:
        non-negative number - number of pieces of the splitted string, negative number - -(number of pieces of the splitted string + 1). Negative number means that target array is too small to receive content (nothing will be filled in this case)
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - when either source or target parameter is null
        IllegalArgumentException - when splitter is null or empty
        Since:
        0.0.2

                          String... content)
